newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Chrysler upgraded to buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Chrysler upgraded to buy.

text.p: Salomon Brothers analyst Jack Kirnan upgraded Chrysler Corp to a buy from a hold with a 12-month price target of $42 a share. He said Chrysler has underperformed the S&P 500 and has a low multiple compared with other members of Detroit's Big Three.

-- Kirnan also raised his 1998 earnings estimate to $5.75 a share from $4.75. He said new products in the 1998 model year could earn a combined $2 billion in 1998, offsetting a $1 billion negative impact from Chrysler's minivan and Grand Cherokee during the year. The automaker is also expected to step up cost reductions in 1997 and 1998.

-- Kirnan said he expects the Chrysler board to initiate a $1-$2 billion share buyback for 1998 at the September board meeting and a dividend hike to $1.80 a share on an annual basis from the current $1.60.
-- Chrysler shares were unchanged at 34-7/8. The company reported second quarter earnings Friday of $0.70 a share after a negative strike impact of $0.64, versus $1.38.
